intro: Senecio malvifolius, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy composite flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a notable species in its native habitat.
